Situation report

Source: R/dr_here.R
dr_here.Rd

dr_here() shows a message that by default also includes the reason why here() is set to a particular directory. Use this function if here() gives unexpected results.

dr_here(show_reason = TRUE)

Arguments

show_reason

[logical(1)]
Include reason in output of dr_here(), defaults to TRUE.

Examples

dr_here()
#> here() starts at /home/runner/work/here/here.
#> - This directory contains a file matching "[.]Rproj$" with contents matching "^Version: " in the first line
#> - Initial working directory: /home/runner/work/here/here
#> - Current working directory: /tmp/RtmpeJ0O5B/file295f1e4342e5/reference
